memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Fear not, for I am with thee; be not dismayed; for I am thy God.” — Isaiah 41:10

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text: Hesitation is a great hindrance. Many, though blessed with talent, ability, and grace, cannot progress because of hesitation. This hesitation is often ruled by low self-esteem and lack of confidence. Such people shrink back, and their God-given talents remain unused. Even in spiritual life, many who have received divine calling and gifts hesitate to move forward boldly. Their talents get buried and bring no fruit. Without their cooperation, many ministries remain stagnant. The harvest is plenty, but the laborers are few. Let us pray that this spirit of hesitation be removed from us. God can turn timidity into courage, fear into faith, and hesitation into holy boldness. Let the hesitant hearts rise and shine for God’s glory.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “God doesn’t call the qualified; He qualifies the called.” — A.W. Tozer

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, remove every hesitation in me. Fill me with faith, courage, and boldness to use my gifts for Your glory. Let my life shine for You. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May your faith rise above fear.
May your steps boldly build God’s Kingdom.
